chinese: Impact is a unlimed font published by the designer Joof Rui Li in 1965, based on Helvetica, its special stroke, the tightening spacing, and the narrow interior space is characteristic, just as the name Impact (compress) Indicated. This type of X word is high, almost approaching two-thirds of its uppercase letters, so the liter is quite short, and this is even more such. Because the font is more rough, it is suitable for use on the title and often appears in the innervation.  Impact is one of the fonts of the web pages and is released with the Microsoft Windows system.  == See also ==  Font  Noble  Liner  Font list
